meanings.definition: Play (a chord) as a series of notes one after the other.
meanings.sent1: She arpeggiated the chord on the guitar, playing each note separately.
meanings.sent2: The musician arpeggiated the chord beautifully during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to arpeggiate the chord on the piano, causing a cacophony of sounds.
meanings.sent4: His fingers danced on the strings, arpeggiating the chord with precision.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the arpeggiated chord echoed through the room, mesmerizing the audience.

meanings.sent1: The arpeggiated melody flowed smoothly, captivating the listeners.
meanings.sent2: The song had an arpeggiated section that added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent3: The arpeggiated pattern in the music made everyone want to dance.
meanings.sent4: Her voice soared over the arpeggiated accompaniment, creating a magical atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The arpeggiated notes created a dreamy ambiance, transporting the audience to another world.
